results.title: Salmonella typhimurium Endocarditis and Myocarditis in a Cat
results.text_hl: The @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ was treated with @CHEMICAL_marbofloxacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C080260 @@@marbofloxacin@@@ (2 mg/kg IM every 24 hours), @CHEMICAL_Cefazolin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002437 @@@cefazoline@@@ (20 mg/kg SC every 12 hours), @CHEMICAL_Metronidazole @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008795 @@@metronidazole@@@ (10 mg/Kg IV every 12 hours), @CHEMICAL_Clopidogrel @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077144 @@@clopidogrel@@@ (18.75 mg PO every 24 hours), @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (0.5 mg/kg OS every 12 hours), and fluid therapy (ringer acetate 2.5 ml/kg/h), but after three days in hospital the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ died from presumed @<m>DISEASE_Shock_Septic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012772 @@@septic shock@@@.

citations.NLM: Vercelli A, Lo Cicero E, Pazzini L.  Salmonella typhimurium Endocarditis and Myocarditis in a Cat Case Rep Vet Med. 2019;2019():7390530. PMID: 31886018
